name: Modules.Newsstand
summary: The Newsstand module allows you to access Apple's NewsKit APIs

events.name: progress
events.summary: Occurs if you call downloadAsset and an issue asset is downloading. This event is only sent when the application is running in the foreground.
events.description: Note: totalBytes only applies to the current file being downloaded.

properties.name: name
properties.summary: The unique name of the issue the asset is being downloaded for.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.summary: The dictionary of key value pairs that was set when calling downloadAsset.

properties.name: bytesWritten
properties.summary: The number of bytes downloaded.

properties.name: totalBytes
properties.summary: The total number of bytes to download for the current asset.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: error
events.summary: Occurs when there is an error while downloading an asset.

properties.name: name
properties.summary: The unique name of the issue the asset is being downloaded for.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.summary: The dictionary of key value pairs that was set when calling downloadAsset.

properties.name: description
properties.summary: Description of the error.

properties.name: code
properties.summary: The error code.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: name
properties.summary: The unique name of the issue the asset is being downloaded for.

properties.name: userInfo
properties.summary: The dictionary of key value pairs that was set when calling downloadAsset.

properties.name: filePath
properties.summary: The location of the file that was downloaded.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: issuecomplete
events.summary: Occurs when all of the asset downloads that have been started for an issue are complete. This could be a successful completion or error.

properties.name: name
properties.summary: The unique name of the issue.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: addIssue
methods.description:
Throws an exception if name and date are invalid. Also throws an exception if you use a name that is already taken by another issue.

Returns a Modules.Newsstand.Issue representing the issue that was added to the library or undefined if the issues could not be added to the library.

Example

var issueDate = new Date();
issueDate.setFullYear(2013);
issueDate.setMonth(0);
issueDate.setDate(14);
var issue = Newsstand.addIssue({
    name: "Magazine-0", 
    date: issueDate
});

methods.name: beginBackgroundDownloadRequests
methods.summary: Signals the start of a series of downloadAsset calls. This call notifies the device that additional time may be needed by the application while running in the background.

methods.name: enableDevMode
methods.summary: Newsstand push notifications are only allowed one background download per day. This function will disable this limit for development devices during testing.
methods.description:
Note: A development device refers to a device which has been recognized in Xcode Organizer as having the "Use for Development" checkbox enabled.

Example

Newsstand.enableDevMode();

methods.name: endBackgroundDownloadRequests
methods.summary: Signals the end of a series of downloadAsset calls. This call notifies the device that the application no longer requires additional time while running in the background.

methods.name: getIssue
methods.summary: Retrieves an issue from the library via its unique name.
methods.description:
Returns a Modules.Newsstand.Issue representing the issue or undefined if the issue does not exist in the library.

Example

var issue = Newsstand.getIssue({
	name: "Magazine-0"
});

methods.name: removeIssue
methods.description:
Note: It is possible to hold on to a Modules.Newsstand.Issue even after it is removed from the library. This is not something you want to do, because issues are useless if they are not in the library. Most of the properties of the issue will still be available excelpt contentURL which will be undefined.

Example

Newsstand.removeIssue(issueToRemove);

methods.name: setBasicAuthentication
methods.summary: Sets the username and password that will be used if the downloadAsset call needs to authenticate.

properties.name: applicationIconBadgeNumber
properties.summary: Accesses or sets the icon badge number of the app. Instead of displaying a badge number on the app icon, this will set the "new" badge on the app icon if the number is greater than 0.

properties.name: currentlyReadingIssue
properties.summary:
Accesses or sets the newsstand issue that the user is currently reading. If no issue is set, it will be undefined.

Newsstand Kit takes this setting into consideration when it purges back issues because of low levels of available flash storage.

properties.name: iconImage
properties.summary: Sets the image of the application icon.
properties.description:
Note: If the image is not within the dimensions outlined in the Newsstand Icon section of the iOS Human Interface Guidelines, it may not be displayed.

Note: Sometimes this does not work on the simulator. Works consistently on device.

Example

var file = Ti.Filesystem.getFile(Ti.Filesystem.applicationDataDirectory,'newIcon.png');
Newsstand.iconImage = file;

properties.name: issues
properties.summary: Returns an array of Modules.Newsstand.Issues representing the current issues in the library.

constants.name: ISSUE_CONTENT_STATUS_AVAILABLE
constants.summary: Downloading of assets is not taking place and there is issue content at contentURL.

constants.name: ISSUE_CONTENT_STATUS_DOWNLOADING
constants.summary: The issue has assets that are currently downloading.

constants.name: ISSUE_CONTENT_STATUS_NONE
constants.summary: Assets are not downloading for the issue and there is no content at contentURL.
